title: Authors and Citation
text: Luginbuhl F, Brüggemann S (2024). swissMunicipalities: Get official historicized lists Swiss municipalities. R package version 0.0.2, http://swissstatsr.org/swissMunicipalities/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {swissMunicipalities: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities},   author = {Felix Luginbuhl and Salim Brüggemann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {http://swissstatsr.org/swissMunicipalities/}, }

what: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: swissMunicipalities gives access official historicized lists municipalities Switzerland using official REST API Swiss Federal Statistical Office. information API can found .

title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: can install development version swissMunicipalities like :

what: Get historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities

previous_headings: Get historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: Use get_snapshots() get “snapshot” municipalities (Level = 1), districts (Level = 2) cantons (Level = 3) today. default, FSO number returned. get historicized ID, add hist_id = TRUE get_snapshots() function. want get snapshot given period, use exist least part specified period (specified day start_period end_period exact date). ℹ️ using start_period end_period arguments, date format “yyyy-mm-dd” (example “2024-08-01”). Using Level column, can extract existing list cantons (Level = 1), districts (Level = 2) municipalities (Level = 3) join consolidate municipality dataset. Note CODE_OFS* variables refers official Swiss community identification number (also called “GEOSTAT”/“BFS” number) CODE_HIST* corresponds “historical number”.
code: snapshot <- get_snapshots() # snapshot of today by default  snapshot ## # A tibble: 2,300 × 29 ##    Identi…¹ Valid…² ValidTo Level Parent Name_en Name_fr Name_de Name_it ABBRE…³ ##       <dbl> <chr>   <lgl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1        1 12.09.… NA          1     NA Zürich  Zürich  Zürich  Zürich  ZH      ##  2    10053 12.09.… NA          2      1 Bezirk… Bezirk… Bezirk… Bezirk… Affolt… ##  3    10575 12.09.… NA          3  10053 Stalli… Stalli… Stalli… Stalli… <NA>    ##  4    11742 12.09.… NA          3  10053 Affolt… Affolt… Affolt… Affolt… <NA>    ##  5    11801 12.09.… NA          3  10053 Bonste… Bonste… Bonste… Bonste… <NA>    ##  6    11992 01.01.… NA          3  10053 Hausen… Hausen… Hausen… Hausen… <NA>    ##  7    12249 12.09.… NA          3  10053 Heding… Heding… Heding… Heding… <NA>    ##  8    12433 12.09.… NA          3  10053 Mettme… Mettme… Mettme… Mettme… <NA>    ##  9    12497 12.09.… NA          3  10053 Obfeld… Obfeld… Obfeld… Obfeld… <NA>    ## 10    12671 01.01.… NA          3  10053 Kappel… Kappel… Kappel… Kappel… <NA>    ## # … with 2,290 more rows, 19 more variables: ABBREV_1_Text_fr <chr>, ## #   ABBREV_1_Text_de <chr>, ABBREV_1_Text_it <chr>, ABBREV_1_Text <chr>, ## #   CODE_OFS_1_Text_en <dbl>, CODE_OFS_1_Text_fr <dbl>, ## #   CODE_OFS_1_Text_de <dbl>, CODE_OFS_1_Text_it <dbl>, CODE_OFS_1_Text <dbl>, ## #   INSCRIPTION_1_Text_en <dbl>, INSCRIPTION_1_Text_fr <dbl>, ## #   INSCRIPTION_1_Text_de <dbl>, INSCRIPTION_1_Text_it <dbl>, ## #   INSCRIPTION_1_Text <dbl>, REC_TYPE_1_Text_en <lgl>, … get_snapshots(start_period = "2023-01-01", end_period = "2023-12-31") ## # A tibble: 2,305 × 34 ##    Identi…¹ Valid…² ValidTo Level Parent Name_en Name_fr Name_de Name_it ABBRE…³ ##       <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1        1 12.09.… <NA>        1     NA Zürich  Zürich  Zürich  Zürich  ZH      ##  2    10053 12.09.… <NA>        2      1 Bezirk… Bezirk… Bezirk… Bezirk… Affolt… ##  3    10575 12.09.… <NA>        3  10053 Stalli… Stalli… Stalli… Stalli… <NA>    ##  4    11742 12.09.… <NA>        3  10053 Affolt… Affolt… Affolt… Affolt… <NA>    ##  5    11801 12.09.… <NA>        3  10053 Bonste… Bonste… Bonste… Bonste… <NA>    ##  6    11992 01.01.… <NA>        3  10053 Hausen… Hausen… Hausen… Hausen… <NA>    ##  7    12249 12.09.… <NA>        3  10053 Heding… Heding… Heding… Heding… <NA>    ##  8    12433 12.09.… <NA>        3  10053 Mettme… Mettme… Mettme… Mettme… <NA>    ##  9    12497 12.09.… <NA>        3  10053 Obfeld… Obfeld… Obfeld… Obfeld… <NA>    ## 10    12671 01.01.… <NA>        3  10053 Kappel… Kappel… Kappel… Kappel… <NA>    ## # … with 2,295 more rows, 24 more variables: ABBREV_1_Text_fr <chr>, ## #   ABBREV_1_Text_de <chr>, ABBREV_1_Text_it <chr>, ABBREV_1_Text <chr>, ## #   CODE_OFS_1_Text_en <dbl>, CODE_OFS_1_Text_fr <dbl>, ## #   CODE_OFS_1_Text_de <dbl>, CODE_OFS_1_Text_it <dbl>, CODE_OFS_1_Text <dbl>, ## #   INSCRIPTION_1_Text_en <dbl>, INSCRIPTION_1_Text_fr <dbl>, ## #   INSCRIPTION_1_Text_de <dbl>, INSCRIPTION_1_Text_it <dbl>, ## #   INSCRIPTION_1_Text <dbl>, RADIATION_1_Text_en <dbl>, … library(dplyr) # just for data wrangling examples  municipalities <- snapshot |>    filter(Level == 3) |>   rename_with(~ paste0(.x, "_municipality", recycle0 = TRUE)) |>   select(-Level_municipality)  districts <- snapshot |>    filter(Level == 2) |>   rename_with(~ paste0(.x, "_district", recycle0 = TRUE)) |>   select(-Level_district)  cantons <- snapshot |>    filter(Level == 1) |>   rename_with(~ paste0(.x, "_canton", recycle0 = TRUE)) |>   select(-Level_canton)  # consolidate municipality data with districts and cantons levels municipalities_consolidated <- municipalities |>   left_join(districts, by = join_by(Parent_municipality == Identifier_district)) |>   left_join(cantons, by = join_by(Parent_district == Identifier_canton)) |>   rename(Identifier_district = Parent_municipality, Identifier_canton = Parent_district) |>   select(starts_with(c("Name", "ABBREV", "Identifier", "Valid")), everything()) |>   arrange(Identifier_municipality, Identifier_district)  # get all municipalities of St. Gallen for the given period municipalities_consolidated |>   filter(Name_de_canton == "St. Gallen") ##  2 Muolen        Muolen  Muolen  Muolen  Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  3 St. Gallen    St. Ga… St. Ga… St. Ga… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  4 Wittenbach    Witten… Witten… Witten… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  5 Berg (SG)     Berg (… Berg (… Berg (… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  6 Eggersriet    Eggers… Eggers… Eggers… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  7 Goldach       Goldach Goldach Goldach Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  8 Mörschwil     Mörsch… Mörsch… Mörsch… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ##  9 Rorschach     Rorsch… Rorsch… Rorsch… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ## 10 Rorschacherb… Rorsch… Rorsch… Rorsch… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… Wahlkr… St. Ga… ## previous_headings: Get historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: Access mutation list describes changes related municipalities occurred specified period. exclude records concern territory changes, use include_territory_exchange = FALSE.
code: get_mutations(start_period = "2023-01-01", end_period = "2023-12-31", include_territory_exchange = FALSE) ## # A tibble: 13 × 14 ##    MutationNum…¹ Mutat…² Initi…³ Initi…⁴ Initi…⁵ Initi…⁶ Initi…⁷ Initi…⁸ Termi…⁹ ##            <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> ##  1          3964 01.01.…   11735      21 Adlikon   10082 Bezirk…      29   16621 ##  2          3964 01.01.…   12173      32 Humlik…   10082 Bezirk…      29   16621 ##  3          3964 01.01.…   13214      30 Andelf…   10082 Bezirk…      26   16621 ##  4          3965 01.01.…   15116     536 Diemer…   10288 Verwal…      29   16622 ##  5          3966 01.01.…   14441    3372 Hemberg   10264 Wahlkr…      29   16623 ##  6          3966 01.01.…   14444    3375 Oberhe…   10264 Wahlkr…      29   16623 ##  7          3966 01.01.…   14950    3378 Necker…   10264 Wahlkr…      26   16623 ##  8          3967 01.01.…   13302    6744 La Cha…   10225 Distri…      29   16624 ##  9          3968 01.01.…   11503    4133 Burg (…   10022 Bezirk…      29   16625 ## 10          3969 01.01.…   10849    4179 Ueken     10021 Bezirk…      29   16626 ## 11          3969 01.01.…   12317    4166 Herzna…   10021 Bezirk…      29   16626 ## 12          3970 01.01.…   13334    6787 Damphr…   10226 Distri…      29   16627 ## 13          3970 01.01.…   13340    6793 Lugnez    10226 Distri…      29   16627 ## # … with 5 more variables: TerminalCode <dbl>, TerminalName <chr>, ## #   TerminalParentHistoricalCode <dbl>, TerminalParentName <chr>, ## #   TerminalStep <dbl>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​MutationNumber, ## #   ²​MutationDate, ³​InitialHistoricalCode, ⁴​InitialCode, ⁵​InitialName, ## #   ⁶​InitialParentHistoricalCode, ⁷​InitialParentName, ⁸​InitialStep, ## #   ⁹​TerminalHistoricalCode

previous_headings: Get historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: Get municipality correspondances, indicates municipality existing start_period time, /corresponding municipality(ies) end_period time. exclude districts municipalities undergone changes, add include_unmodified = FALSE.
code: get_correspondances(   start_period = "2022-01-01",    end_period = "2022-12-31",    include_unmodified = FALSE,    include_territory_exchange = FALSE ) ## # A tibble: 5 × 12 ##   InitialHisto…¹ Initi…² Initi…³ Initi…⁴ Initi…⁵ Initi…⁶ Termi…⁷ Termi…⁸ Termi…⁹ ##            <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   ## 1          12412    5197 Melano    10003 Distre…      29   16619    5240 Val Ma… ## 2          12762    5195 Marogg…   10003 Distre…      29   16619    5240 Val Ma… ## 3          12848    5219 Rovio     10003 Distre…      29   16619    5240 Val Ma… ## 4          14099    3103 Rüte      10252 Kanton…      29   16620    3112 Schwen… ## 5          14101    3105 Schwen…   10252 Kanton…      29   16620    3112 Schwen… ## # … with 3 more variables: TerminalParentHistoricalCode <dbl>, ## #   TerminalParentName <chr>, TerminalStep <dbl>, and abbreviated variable ## #   names ¹​InitialHistoricalCode, ²​InitialCode, ³​InitialName, ## #   ⁴​InitialParentHistoricalCode, ⁵​InitialParentName, ⁶​InitialStep, ## #   ⁷​TerminalHistoricalCode, ⁸​TerminalCode, ⁹​TerminalName

previous_headings: Get historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: geographical levels offer several classifications municipalities according , example, linguistic regions, agglomerations even degree urbanization. default, FSO number returned. get historicized ID, add hist_id = TRUE get_levels() function. can change label_languages French (“fr”), German (“de”), Italian (“”) English (“en”).

title: Get official historicized lists of Swiss municipalities
text: R package inspired swissmuni. swissmuni available latest version R rely several R package dependencies CRAN, R package provides simplified R wrapper API minimal dependencies can used older versions R (R >= 4.0).

title: Get municipalities correspondances — get_correspondances
text: correspondences indicate municipality existing start_period time, /corresponding municipality(ies) end_period time.

title: Get municipalities correspondances — get_correspondances
code: get_correspondances(   start_period = Sys.Date(),   end_period = Sys.Date(),   include_unmodified = NULL,   include_territory_exchange = NULL,   escape_chars = NULL,   name_repair = "unique" )

title: Get municipalities correspondances — get_correspondances
text: start_period Start requested period end_period End requested period include_unmodified Include municipalities undergone changes include_territory_exchange Include/exclude records concern territory changes. escape_chars Defines forbidden characters response respective escape characters. example, value "/( ).(_)", slashes response replaced space periods replaced underscore. name_repair read_csv used internally ensures column names "unique" using "name_repeir" argument.

title: Get municipalities correspondances — get_correspondances
text: data.frame/tibble

title: Get municipalities correspondances — get_correspondances
code: # \donttest{ get_correspondances(start_period = "2024-01-01", end_period = "2024-08-01") #> # A tibble: 4 × 12 #>   InitialHistoricalCode InitialCode InitialName InitialParentHistoricalCode #>                   <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>                             <dbl> #> 1                 12547          64 Nürensdorf                        10081 #> 2                 12547          64 Nürensdorf                        10081 #> 3                 12673          62 Kloten                            10081 #> 4                 12673          62 Kloten                            10081 #> # ℹ 8 more variables: InitialParentName <chr>, InitialStep <dbl>, #> #   TerminalHistoricalCode <dbl>, TerminalCode <dbl>, TerminalName <chr>, #> #   TerminalParentHistoricalCode <dbl>, TerminalParentName <chr>, #> #   TerminalStep <dbl> # }

title: Get municipalities levels — get_levels
text: geographical levels offer several classifications municipalities according , example, linguistic regions, agglomerations even degree urbanization.

title: Get municipalities levels — get_levels
code: get_levels(   start_period = Sys.Date(),   end_period = Sys.Date(),   escape_chars = NULL,   hist_id = NULL,   label_languages = c("", "de", "fr", "it", "en"),   name_repair = "unique" )

title: Get municipalities levels — get_levels
text: start_period Start requested period end_period End requested period escape_chars Defines forbidden characters response respective escape characters. example, value "/( ).(_)", slashes response replaced space periods replaced underscore. hist_id Determines whether BFSNR (snapshot) HISTID (geographic levels) delivered. label_languages Include labels specified languages. Languages specified using ISO 639-1 code (.e., French ("fr"), German ("de"), Italian ("") English ("en")) separated comma ",". name_repair read_csv used internally ensures column names "unique" using "name_repeir" argument.

title: Get municipalities levels — get_levels
text: data.frame/tibble

title: Get municipalities mutations — get_mutations
text: Mutation list describes changes related municipalities occurred specified period.

title: Get municipalities mutations — get_mutations
code: get_mutations(   start_period = Sys.Date(),   end_period = Sys.Date(),   escape_chars = NULL,   include_territory_exchange = NULL,   name_repair = "unique" )

title: Get municipalities mutations — get_mutations
text: start_period Start requested period end_period End requested period escape_chars Defines forbidden characters response respective escape characters. example, value "/( ).(_)", slashes response replaced space periods replaced underscore. include_territory_exchange Include/exclude records concern territory changes. name_repair read_csv used internally ensures column names "unique" using "name_repeir" argument.

title: Get municipalities snapshots — get_snapshots
text: snapshot list municipalities exist least part specified period (specified day start_period = end_period)

title: Get municipalities snapshots — get_snapshots
code: get_snapshots(   start_period = Sys.Date(),   end_period = Sys.Date(),   escape_chars = NULL,   hist_id = NULL,   name_repair = "unique" )

title: Get municipalities snapshots — get_snapshots
text: start_period Start requested period end_period End requested period escape_chars Defines forbidden characters response respective escape characters. example, value "/( ).(_)", slashes response replaced space periods replaced underscore. hist_id Determines whether BFSNR (snapshot) HISTID (geographic levels) delivered. name_repair read_csv used internally ensures column names "unique" using "name_repair" argument.

text: data.frame/tibble
